bnf_parser.callables

Class Callable

  • java.lang.Object
    • bnf_parser.callables.Callable
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MatchAnyRule, MatchPattern, MatchRule

    public abstract class Callable
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class represents the heart of the parsing process. Every rule contains one or more (subclasses of) Callable in an ordered list. The BnfParser calls the parse(SubparserInterface) method of every Callable. If all calls return true, then the rule matched successfully. Otherwise, if any call returns false, then the parsing failed (the rule did not match). Every callable has a minimum number of occurences (can be 0) and a maximum number of occurences (can be up to Integer.MAX_VALUE which is considered 'infinity').
    Author:
    Hubert Lemelin

    • Field Detail

      • minOccurences

        protected int minOccurences
        The minimum number of occurences this Callable must match. Can be 0.

      • maxOccurences

        protected int maxOccurences
        The maximum number of occurences this Callable must match. Can be 'infinity' which corresponds to Integer.MAX_VALUE.

      • collectors

        private java.util.ArrayList<Collector> collectors
        Contains all the Collector's returned by the parser. Usually, only one Collector is returned, but sometimes, especially in MatchRule, there can be more than one Callable's returned.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Callable

        protected Callable(int minOccurences,
                   int maxOccurences)
        Initializes properties.
        Parameters:
        minOccurences - The minimum number of occurences that must match.
        maxOccurences - The maximum number of occurences that must match.

    • Method Detail

      • getCollector

        public Collector getCollector()
                       throws CallableContainsMoreThanOneCollectorException
        Returns the only Collector contained in collectors.
        Returns:
        The only Collector contained in collectors if there is exactly one. If none exists, it returns NULL.
        Throws:
        CallableContainsMoreThanOneCollectorException - Thrown if more than one Collector exists.

      • getCollectors

        public Collector[] getCollectors()
        Returns all the Collector's in an array.
        Returns:
        All the Collector's as an array.

      • parse

        public abstract boolean parse(SubparserInterface parser)
        Abstract method that must be defined by subclasses which is the heart of the parsing process. This is the method that decided whether or not the current rule/subrule succeeds or fails.
        Parameters:
        parser - The current instance of a parser implementign SubparserInterface.
        Returns:
        True if parsing is successful, false otherwise.

      • resetCollectors

        protected void resetCollectors()
        (re) Initializes collectors.

        Used by subclasses to add a Collector when parsing succeeds.

        collector -
